Class Hospital<PatientType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • Hospital<PatientType>
  • Type Parameters:
    PatientType - The generic type for the type of patient that the Hospital accepts.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PriorityQueueHospital, QueueHospital, StackHospital

    public abstract class Hospital<PatientType>
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing a Hospital. Hospitals store a collection of patients who are waiting to receive medical treatment. Patients are treated one at a time by some defined ordering. How to determine which patient to treat next is the responsibility of the Hospital subclasses. Once a patient is treated, it is removed from the Hospital. Hospitals may have different types of patients. In the case of this lab, the two general patient types used are Person and Animal.
    Version:
    2019-03-07
    Author:
    Stephen

    • Method Detail

      • addPatient

        public abstract void addPatient(PatientType patient)
        Add a patient to the Hospital.
        Parameters:
        patient - The patient to be added.

      • nextPatient

        public abstract PatientType nextPatient()
        Find and return the patient who will next be treated. Does not treat the patient (i.e. it is not removed from the collection of patients that the hospital still must treat).
        Returns:
        The patient who would be next treated.

      • treatNextPatient

        public abstract PatientType treatNextPatient()
        Treats the next patient and removes them from the Hospital. Once someone is healed they no longer need to stay in the Hospital.
        Returns:
        The patient receiving treatment.

      • numPatients

        public abstract int numPatients()
        Calculate and return the number of patients still in the hospital (untreated).
        Returns:
        The number of patients in the Hospital.

      • hospitalType

        public abstract java.lang.String hospitalType()
        Gives a String for the hospital type.
        Returns:
        A string exactly matching the class name.

      • allPatientInfo

        public abstract java.lang.String allPatientInfo()
        Prints all patient information.
        Returns:
        The toString of all patients, concatenated (don't add spaces, newlines, etc...).

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns some information about the Hospital and its occupancy.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The string "A %s-type hospital with %d patients.", with replacements of the hospitalType and the number of patients.
